item.title: Matrix Base
item.description:
Determinant of Matrix Product

Theorem

Let $\mathbf{A}, \mathbf{B}$ be a square matrices of order n.

Let $ det(A) $ be the determinant of $ A $.

Let $$ AB $$ be the matrix product of $$ A $$ and $$ B $$.

Then:

$$ det(AB) = det(A)det(B) $$

Proof

Consider two cases:

  1. $$ A $$ is singular.

  2. $$ A $$ is nonsingular.

proof of case1

Assume $$ A $$ is singular.
